isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1997) - SECTION 3.5: CIRCUIT FUNCTION AND DIAGNOSTICS - CRUISE CONTROL, PTO, HAND THROTTLE SYSTEM - REMOTE PEDAL SENSOR (RPS)

svcproc.title: REMOTE PEDAL SENSOR (RPS)
svcproc.para: The RPS receives R-VREF (5V) from ECM terminal 44, through body builder connector (429), terminal 12. As the pedal position is changed, the wiper sends the variable RPS signal through body builder connector (429), terminal 11 to ECM terminal 30. The ECM expects to see a signal between 152 mV and 4.55 volts. This signal is interpreted by the ECM as percent of throttle, from 0 to 100 percent. The RPS sensor is grounded through body builder connector (429), terminal 10 to ECM terminal 51 (SIG RTN).
